data.title: Disney Interactive Studios, Inc. history
data.meta_description: List of historic events for Disney Interactive Studios, Inc.
data.text:
July 1, 2010

It is revealed the company has acquired the iPhone development studio Tapulous, Inc.

September 8, 2009

The company announces to have acquired the development studio Wideload Games, Inc.

April 7, 2008

The company announces to acquire Gamestar (China) Ltd.

July 12, 2007

The company acquires Warren Spector's Junction Point Studios.

November 7, 2006

The company announces the formation of Fall Line Studios, based in Salt Lake City, a new video game development studio dedicated to develop games based on Disneyâ€™s characters, as well as new IP, for the Nintendo DS and Nintendo Wii.

September 28, 2006

The company acquires the Climax Racing studio.

April 22, 2005

The company announces that starting from summer 2005, it will become a multi-platform publisher in the UK, Germany and France. They will also broaden their focus from kids and family games to teen and core games.

April 19, 2005

The company acquires Avalanche Software and sets up Propaganda Games, a new studio in Vancouver, Canada, founded by Josh Holmes, Howard Donaldson, Daryl Anselmo and Jorge Freitas.

March 14, 2003

Disney Interactive changes its name to Buena Vista Games.

1995
